name: src/core/EventTarget.js
EventTarget
description:
The EventTarget is a class that allows the use of custom events in it's instances. it is an implementation of the
Pub/Sub pattern.

It is generally not used directly but is inherited from in other classes

name: constructor
description: This MUST be called by sub-classes to instantiate the correct properties where events are stored.

name: on
description: Register an event handler for a type

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the event. A custom human readable string.

params.name: handler
params.description: The function that will be invoked when the event is triggered. No signature is provided, it is up to the developer to determine what is passed to the listener at trigger time

params.name: context
params.description: The object the listener will called on. Defaults to `this` and can be changed if event delegation is needed.

name: once
description: Register an event handler that will trigger only once

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the event. A custom human readable string.

params.name: handler
params.description: The function that will be invoked when the event is triggered. No signature is provided, it is up to the developer to determine what is passed to the listener at trigger time

params.name: context
params.description: The object the listener will called on. Defaults to `this` and can be changed if event delegation is needed.

name: off
description: Remove event handler, either of one type, or just one listener

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the event. A custom human readable string.

params.name: handler
params.description: The event handler to be removed. If unspecififed, all handlers of the supplied type are removed.

name: listenTo
description: Utility to allow EventTargets to listen to other EventTarget's events easily

params.name: target
params.description: The instance of EventTarget to listen to events on

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the event. A custom human readable string.

params.name: handler
params.description: The function that will be invoked when the event is triggered. No signature is provided, it is up to the developer to determine what is passed to the listener at trigger time

name: stopListening
description: Stop listening for events on another EventTarget

params.name: target
params.description: The instance of EventTarget to stop receiving events from.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the event. A custom human readable string.

name: hasListeners
description: Determine if this object has events registered of a certain type

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} if the EventTarget has listeners for this type of event

params.name: type
params.description: Event type to check.

return.description: if the EventTarget has listeners for this type of event

name: trigger
description: Trigger an event on this object

params.name: type
params.description: The event type who's listeners will be triggered

params.name: eventParams
params.description: The parameters to be passed to the listening objects. Any number can be passed but it is recomended to only pass a single event object on which you may attach multiple properties.

name: src/display/BaseView.js
breakpointHandler
description: Single event handler from WindowManager breakpoint event. Handles calling of breakpointChanged on each instance if applicable

name: BaseView
description:
BaseView is the base class for organizing the DOM. It extends EventTarget to allow event based communication between
Views and their parents or other parts of the application that also inherit from EventTarget.

BaseView enables easily adding DOM Events by doing the book keeping and allowing for event delegation.

params.name: el
params.description:
The Element this view is responsible for. Saved to this.el, a View is always responsible
     For a single root element. The view can then split up it's contained elements with subviews

params.name: options
params.description: An object of options for the view

params.name: options.breakpoints
params.description:
An array of breakpoint objects the view uses. If this options is specified,
     the `breakpointChanged` function will only be called with breakpoints specified here, otherwise it will be called
     for every breakpoint change.

name: breakpointChanged
description: Function is called when breakpoint is changed

params.name: breakpoint
params.description: New breakpoint obejct

params.name: previousBreakpoint
params.description: Breakpoint the browser was resized from.

name: addDomEvent
description: Bind a DOMEvent to the view, optionally filtered on the selector.

params.name: type
params.description: Event typoe

params.name: listener
params.description: Event listener function that will be scoped to this view

params.name: selector
params.description:
If selector is a String, the string will be used to test matching using
     delegated events to `this.el`. If it's an Element then bind event directly to that element.
     Binding directly to an element is usefull for events that don't bubble. (form submit, for example)

name: removeDomEvent
description: Remove DOM event from the element

params.name: target
params.description: The element to remove events from

params.name: type
params.description: The DOM event Type. Special keyword 'all' removes all event types

name: remove
description:
Remove all DOM event listeners and remove the View element from the DOM. This function is used when we want to
remove the element from the DOM but want the view to stay in memory

name: destroy
description:
Removes DOM Element and DOM events. Unbinds other Events.
Call this to clean up the view before de-referencing it.

name: resize
description: Dummy function to implement resizing

name: minWidth
description:
Test to see if the viewport is currently at a certain breakpoint

Proxies WindowManager.minWidth

params.name: breakpoint
params.description: {Number|String|Object} a breakpoint name, object or numerical value. See WindowManager.minWidth for more info

name: src/display/ContainerView.js
ContainerView
description:
A view that can contain other views.
Automatically call resize/breakpointChanged/destroy on children.

name: constructor
description: See super declaration. This view also instantiates a subview array

name: _subViews
description: An array of contained sub views

name: destroy
description: Destroy

name: resize
description: Call resize for all the sub-views

params.name: view
params.description: the sub-view to register with this as a parent

name: _unregisterSubView
description: Remove sub-view from internal array

name: src/display/Popin.js
src/display/PopinManager.js
displayPopin
description: Get Popin's DOM to display in popin-container

params.name: popinView
params.description: instance of Popin class

name: closePopin
description: Remove Popin from popin-container and hide that

params.name: cleanDom
params.description: use to know is method can remove DOM or not

name: src/display/SplitText.js
SplitText
description:
A class to split up lines, words and characters into divs and spans. First it will parse the element's content and store it in nested arrays (see below). It will then empty the div and replace it with divs and spans The internal representation of the split text : ``` [ [ 'l', 'i', 'n', 'e' ],
, [ 'w', 'o', 'r', 'd' ], [ 'w', 'o', 'r', 'd' ] ] ```

params.name: el
params.description: Element who's content will be split

params.name: options
params.description: Options for splitting the text

name: wordFilter
description: When the output is being built, pass every word element through this function

name: charFilter
description: When the output is being built, pass every char element through this function

name: lineClass
description: The CSS class to add to line elements

name: wordClass
description: The CSS class to add to word elements

name: charClass
description: The CSS class to add to char elements

name: _originalHTML
description: Save a string representation of the element's original content

name: _parsedNodes
description: Parsed nodes of the content

name: reset
description: Remove elements generated by text splitting process and re-inject original contents

name: _renderString
description: Return the composed HTML of split text

name: _createChar
description: Create an element for the character. passing through an optional filter and adding a CSS class name

params.name: content
params.description: Single char to create an element for

name: _createWord
description: Returns a span containing multiple characters, passed to the createChar function.

unknown.tagValue: {Element} an element containing multiple char elements

params.name: charArray
params.description: Array of characters

return.description: an element containing multiple char elements

name: _parseNodeContent
description: Loop over element returning an array of elements and words. Each word is an array of chars.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} An array of chars or nested words

params.name: el
params.description: The element to parse

return.description: An array of chars or nested words

name: src/display/StepPopin.js
src/display/dom/empty.js
empty
description: Simple function to empty an element

params.name: el
params.description: DOMElement to empty by removing all it's children.

name: src/display/dom/index.js
index
description: Get index of searchCriteria in a collection of nodes (default is searchCritera's siblings

unknown.tagValue: {number} Index of the search criteria or -1 if the searchCritera was not found in this collection

params.name: searchCriteria
params.description: An element or CSS selector to find an element

params.name: collection
params.description: The array of nodes to search in.

return.description: Index of the search criteria or -1 if the searchCritera was not found in this collection

name: src/display/dom/removeClasses.js
removeClasses
description: Remove multiple classes from an Element. Supports removing classes with `*` wildcard

params.name: el
params.description: DOM element to remove classes from

params.name: patterns
params.description: One or more class patterns. Patterns must be CSS class names but can also contain `*` as a wildcard.

name: src/display/dom/stringToElement.js
stringToElement
description: Turns a string representing one or more DOM elements into usable objects.

unknown.tagValue:
{Element|DocumentFragment} The DOM representation of the string. If multiple root tags are present in the
    string, it will return a DocumentFragment

return.description:
The DOM representation of the string. If multiple root tags are present in the
    string, it will return a DocumentFragment

Keyboard

params.name: target
params.description: The element to listen to events to. Defaults to the document.

name: target
description: DOM event target

name: destroy
description: Stop listening for events

name: _keyPressHandler

params.name: event
params.description: DOM Event object

params.name: event
params.description: DOM event

name: target

params.name: event

name: src/input/Touch.js
GESTURES_DEFINITIONS
description: These constants represent gestures that the touch instance will try to match

name: isMultiTouch
description: Determines if event is detecting mutliple touch points.

params.name: event
params.description: The TouchEvent to test

name: touchDistance
description: Get distance between two touches of an event. Simple square root.

params.name: event
params.description: A multi-touch native touch event

name: touchCenter
description: Get center of touch event's touches.

params.name: event
params.description: The native event to analyse.

return.description: The center the supplied event's touches. If there is a single touch, it will return it's coordinates.

name: Touch
description: Class to track simple touch gestures. Inspired partly by hammer.js
todo: configure gesture detectors to avoid useless operations on multiple objects

params.name: target
params.description: Target of touch events to listen to

params.name: options
params.description: Options for class behavior. See defaults for more info.

name: target
description: Save event target

name: options
description: Saved options with default values.

name: destroy
description: Remove native events and cleanup

name: _start
description: Start tracking touch events on the target element.

params.name: event
params.description: Native DOM event

name: isTouched
description: flag to indicate if there is acutally a touch on the device.

name: _eventBuffer
description: Internal buffer of events to analyse

name: _currentGestures
description: Internal list of gestures currently being detected

params.name: event
params.description: Native DOM event

name: _end
description: End of touch. Reset internal vars

params.name: event
params.description: Native DOM event

name: _touchStartHandler
description: Native start event handler

name: _touchMoveHandler
description: Native move event handler

name: _touchEndHandler
description: Native end event handker

name: src/utils/WindowManager.js
breakpoints
description: Array of breakpoints. You can not change breakpoints once they are set

name: bindScrollEvent
description: Start listening for native window scroll events

name: unbindScrollEvent
description: Stop listening for native window scroll events

name: scrollTo
description: Scroll to this position in the window. Updates the internal variables.

params.name: y
params.description: Move scroll to to here

params.name: x
params.description: Move scroll left to here.

name: minWidth
description: Determine if the viewport is of a a minimum width

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} if the viewport is at least of breakpoint size.

params.name: breakpoint
params.description:
If of type object, assumes to be a named breakpoint object with a value property.
 If a string, a named breakpoint's name. If a number the breakpoint's value. A number maybe used to arbitrarily check window width

return.description: if the viewport is at least of breakpoint size.

name: _updateMetrics
description: Save the window metrics to this object

name: _updateScrollMetrics
description: Update internal var that tracks the scroll position

name: _detectBreakpoint
description: Called on window resize events to detect which breakpoint we're on

params.name: suppressEvents
params.description: Do not trigger a breakpoint event when a change is detected

name: _scrollHandler
description: Internal window scroll handler. This call is throttled

name: _resizeHandler
description: Internal window resize handler. This call is throttled

name: _unloadHandler
description: Called when the window unloads

name: _loadHandler
description: Forward the window load event
